intro: Yuyba, commonly known as the Mexican yucca, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and sword-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Yuyba is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it suitable for arid environments. It is often used in landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental appearance.
